creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
description: matte black teapot (a) with loop handle and long spout; covered with off-white glazed oval medallions with hand-painted illustrations of tools used in making ceramics (wire clay cutter, sculpting tools, brushes, glaze jars, sponge, ribs, wheel, apron); removable round lid (b) with ball-shaped knob and teacup image underneath
text: Minnesota artist Amy Sabrina’s works often featured highly detailed, hand-painted motifs from nature—her way of acknowledging the large role of the environment in her life and work. With this teapot, commissioned by the Roots, Sabrina referenced her own livelihood and processes by covering a teapot with medallions featuring the tools of the potter.
title: Teapot
